latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

item.latestTitle: A bill to prohibit the long-term storage of rail cars on certain railroad tracks unless the Surface Transportation Board has approved the rail carrier's rail car storage plan.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 161, Number 22 (Tuesday, February 10, 2015)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. KLINE:H.R. 844.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3, commonly referred to the``Commerce Clause,'' of the United States Constitution.[Page H918]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials.

item.name: Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials Subcommittee

bill.title: To require a plan approved by the Surface Transportation Board for the long-term storage of rail cars on certain railroad tracks.

item.name: Introduced in House
item.text: Requires a rail carrier to have a storage plan, meeting specified requirements and approved by the Surface Transportation Board, for any of its rail cars that it stores for three or more years, and continues to store, on tracks (except rail yard or storage yard tracks) that pass through a commercial- or residential-zoned area that were designed or previously used for through transportation of trains.

item.title: To require a plan approved by the Surface Transportation Board for the long-term storage of rail cars on certain railroad tracks.
To require a plan approved by the Surface Transportation Board for the long-term storage of rail cars on certain railroad tracks.

committee.name: Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
